series.title: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
series.author: American Public Media

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for March 4, 2017
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been warm there. It's been up in the thirties so the snow's been melting and dripping off the icicles, and the sidewalks are clear." Animals venture into the town's yards to look for food, and Alan Jansky returns for a visit after living in Santa Barbara for years, a monologue from March 2008.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for February 25, 2017
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been warm there. It's been up in the 20s and so we don't know when the other shoe is going to drop but we are sure that it will eventually, sooner rather than later." Myrtle Krebsbach hosts the Valentine's Day supper and dance, rumors swirl after Pastor Inqvist spends a few days in Nashville, and thoughts on the temptation of putting your tongue on a pump handle in the winter, a monologue originally from February 2003.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for February 18, 2017
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been cold here, got down to 30-below wind chill here earlier in the week, starting to warm up a little bit now. They are forecasting more snow for Monday, Tuesday night." Corrine Tollerud returns from St. Olaf College for a weekend, the Hansens attempt to prevent their dog from being hit by cars, Lake Wobegon Lutheran Church holds its Lenten services, and Cindy Hedlund meets someone online after just a few months as a widow, in a monologue from February 2015.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for February 11, 2017
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been cold there. The furnaces are starting to make strange noises and enormous icicles the size of Minuteman missiles hang from the eves down there." A few stories about the host's distinguished East Coast ancestors, the Valentine's Day Robbery on the Great Northern Railroad, and a childhood Valentine's Day experience, in a monologue from February 2004.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for February 4, 2017
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been not quite so cold this last week..." Carl Krebsbach gets into a car accident, conversation at the Sidetrack Tap turns even dumber than usual, and Leland buys the Everett house using money he's made running insurance scams, in a monologue from February 1997.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for January 28, 2017
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It has been unnaturally warm out there and that has gotten the raccoons thinking that this is the breeding season." A mysterious figure skater out on the lake draws a crowd, Senator K. Thorvaldson finally heads south for the winter, and Donald Thorvaldson catches up with a few classmates, in a monologue from January 2015.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for January 21, 2017
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It got ferociously cold here on Thursday--Wednesday and Thursday--so school was canceled on Thursday. They heard about it Thursday morning on the rise-and-shine show Ole and Toivu." Senator K. Thorvaldson prepares for a trip to Arizona, Carl Krebsbach considers giving up the carpentry business, and Pastor Liz's boyfriend Cliff attends another service at the Lutheran Church, in a monologue from January 2014.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for January 14, 2017
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We got a little snow -- a little snow Monday night. What a beautiful snowfall it was, and not all that cold out." The recent warm weather puts those who suffer from "Pump Handle Phobia" at ease. Plus, Mr. Hansen lends a hand around the neighborhood while his wife visits her sister in Florida, and reveals an unusual secret, a monologue from January 2012.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for January 7, 2017
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Our beautiful fall has come to an end. We got a frost here on Monday night. People were talking about it down at the Chatterbox Cafe." Eloise Krebsbach runs for mayor, the Lutheran Church updates its directory, Carl Krebsbach does a few odd jobs around town, and the Hedlunds dig up a Lake Wobegon ghost story, a monologue from October 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for December 31, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "The gospel message this morning at the Lake Wobegon Lutheran Church, in case you missed the service, actually the epistle, was the verse from the Colossians in which it says to put on the clothes of compassion and kindness and to forgive each other as God has forgiven us." A few thoughts on making the transition to a new year, in a brief monologue from December 2006.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for December 24, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been much too warm out there. It's been raining. It looks dreary -- it doesn't look like the festival of lights whatsoever." A series of misunderstandings draws a crowd to Our Lady of Perpetual Responsibility, the Tolleruds reluctantly accept a gift from a NYC relative, Lake Wobegon Lutheran Church celebrates St. Lucia Day, and the high school choir goes caroling, in a monologue from December 2011.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for December 17, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been warm. It's been in the 40s now, so we're having to face up to the prospect of a brown Christmas but we just have to deal with it, that's all." The Tolleruds retrieve and care for their escaped bull, Pastor Liz attempts to increase membership in the men's and women's bible study groups, and Darlene flirts with Nelson Tollefson, a monologue from December 2015.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for December 10, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "You've come to that long, cold, dark time of the year. Not much can be said about that, except that if you have not spent December in the north of Norway, then you don't know what 'cold and dark' is." Pastor Inqvist considers writing a book about Lake Wobegon, Dorothy second-guesses a sentence in her Christmas letter, and Betty Ingebretsen accompanies the 4th and 5th grade carolers at the Good Shepherd Home, in a monologue from December 2014.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for December 3, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We finally got our decent snowfall here on Wednesday night and now Minnesota can look Buffalo and the Yukon in the eye. We need not be ashamed any longer." Mr. Berge enlists shoveling help after the season's first big snowfall, Corrine Tollerud breaks up with her boyfriend, thoughts on modern child rearing, and memories of harrowing school bus rides, in a December 2013 monologue.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for November 26, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been chilly, but then we expected it would be. It's been clear sunny days, cold, clear nights. You can look up and see the stars up there." Lake Wobegon celebrates Thanksgiving by sharing a few stories from years past, the Tollefsons prepare a turkey using their grandmother's recipe, and Pastor Liz's boyfriend attends a service at the Lutheran Church, in a monologue from November 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for November 19, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We got some more snow here this last week and it's been a little bit cold--no big deal. People are cheerful out there. Furnaces are on now." The town prepares for ice fishing season, Solveig returns from California to make lutefisk, and the exiles begin to trickle back home for Thanksgiving, in a monologue from November 2014.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for November 12, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's gotten cold up there, just genuinely cold, and we can tell it's cold because the teenagers are now putting on jackets and scarves and mittens and hats and so forth." Fred contemplates giving up furnace repair and moving to Texas, Lake Wobegon Lutheran Church prepares for its lutefisk dinner, Myron has knee replacement surgery, and Pastor Liz receives a strange call for help in the middle of the night, a monologue from November 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for November 5, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "There was a full moon on Thursday, it snowed a little bit, the sun now goes down before five o'clock and will for a while. Cold is here. The kids are still wearing light jackets because they're from here, that's all." Lake Wobegon Lutheran Church celebrates All Saints' Day and Clint Bunsen gives up deer hunting, a monologue from November 2014.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for October 29, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We had our big frost and it turned cold. All the flowers are dead. They say we'll get some snow before Thanksgiving." Donnie Krebsbach heads to Minneapolis to visit his in-laws and his son returns to town to help a distraught girl learn more about her uncle (who, it turns out, was secretly engaged to Tina Lundeen), a monologue from November 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for October 22, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been chilly, of course, because it is almost the end of October. Mist over the lake every morning, the Canada Geese are heading South overhead." Pastor Liz delivers a sermon about the Parable of the Wedding Feast, a man visits Ralph's Pretty Good Grocery to buy a cup of coffee though they don't sell coffee, and the story of the time Eugene Berge picked up a hitchhiker, in an October 2014 monologue.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for October 15, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's fall. It's a gorgeous, gorgeous fall. It's been chilly, down into the 30s at night." Thoughts on the benefits of cold weather and Minnesota living, the town watches a lunar eclipse, and Pastor Liz moves into the Lewises' cabin, in a monologue from October 2014.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for October 8, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Been chilly, chilly at night, in the 30s. The crickets are all quiet. We hear the 'pop' of the shotguns from duck hunting." With the election approaching, politics begin to affect marriages, Carla Bunsen receives funding for her performance art piece in New York City, and the Lutheran Church holds its Senior Banquet, in a monologue from October 2014.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for October 1, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Homecoming week this week at Lake Wobegon High School, not that we expect alumni to come back--they don't. They come back, maybe, for the holidays." High school students prepare for the homecoming dance, Laurel returns to town from Long Beach, California after 22 years, and Pastor Liz worries after giving a sermon that everyone enjoys, in a monologue from October 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for September 24, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We're all used to disappointment and heartbreak in Lake Wobegon. We're all used to being left behind, of course, it's the story of our lives." Clint Bunsen tries to help a skunk out of a live trap, the host recalls an autumn morning that changed him forever, and Eloise Krebsbach sends her boyfriend to chemical dependency treatment, in a monologue from October 2009.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for September 17, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "This was the week when the weather turned, just came all of a sudden. This last week, the wind shifted around from the North and you could feel that the temperature dropped about 20 degrees." In a monologue from October 2004, the host wades into frigid water to help Uncle Dean and Aunt Evelyn retrieve the dock, and considers Kafka while visiting Prague. Cousin Larry visits relatives in Norway.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for September 10, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been cold and windy there and on the verge of turning warm and sunny, and just when you think it will, we get a little bit of snow, typical for Minnesota at this time of the year." Regulars visit the Chatterbox Café to complain about their lives and Carl Krebsbach reminisces about an early relationship with Anne Marie Meister, a monologue from April 1995.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: SFX - The Minnesota Show for September 3, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: There are a lot of new foods and exhibits at the Minnesota State Fair this year...

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for September 3, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been a beautiful, beautiful last week of summer, especially for those of us who don't have to work -- you know, which I don't, being retired and everything. It heightens the pleasure to see other people working so hard, which you do." Thoughts on growing up as a writer in Lake Wobegon, and a few memories of high school romance at the Minnesota State Fair.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Mel's - The Minnesota Show for September 3, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Mel's Buffet at the Minnesota State Fair: the place to go if you want to avoid salad.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Mom - The Minnesota Show for September 3, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Duane's mom calls while he's attending the Minnesota State Fair.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Guy Noir - The Minnesota Show for September 3, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Guy Noir works security at the Minnesota State Fair and accidentally interrupts a public radio podcast.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for August 27, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been hot there this last week -- got up to 93 on Wednesday and that took the starch out of Norwegian Bachelor Farmers in particular." Thoughts on the benefits of summer cabins, the Inqvists reconcile after a night at the Moonlight Bay Supper Club, and Arlene Bunsen holds a bridal shower for her nephew's fiancée, in a monologue from June 2015.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for August 20, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been chilly, been cloudy this whole week but we're used to it. It doesn't really matter." Lake Wobegon High School's class of 2013 graduates, tales of graduation ceremony pranks from years past, and thoughts on being a commencement speaker, in a monologue from June 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for August 13, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been hot and humid out there. Some people are sitting around limp in the face of their air conditioners with their arms wrapped around them and a lot of people are not so troubled by 105-degree heat." Carl Krebsbach soldiers on through a heatwave while repairing the siding on the Bunsens' house, memories of the winter Great Aunt Cooter went berserk can help keep you cool during a summer heatwave, the Dieners' daughter postpones her wedding and this makes people think about the state of their own marriages, in a monologue from July 2011.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for August 6, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We had some thunderstorms in Lake Wobegon this last week. We say it was a quiet week in Lake Wobegon but it was kind of wild and kind of violent." The Whippets defeat the Holdingford Bulls in the rain on another long fly ball from Wayne Tommerdahl, Father Emil returns to Our Lady of Perpetual Responsibility, garage sale season begins, and the Women's Bible Study Group goes skinny-dipping, in a monologue from June 2014.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for July 30, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Glorious, glorious, glorious, magnificent week of fall. These beautiful, beautiful trees -- such splendor, such majesty." Pastor Inqvist gets a new hat; encounters Merle Sanderson, one of the Lutheran pastors who was with him during an infamous pontoon boat incident; performs a last-minute baptism; and receives a troubling telephone message -- a monologue from October 2000.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for July 23, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Such a beautiful, beautiful, heartbreaking, terribly beautiful fall. You go out and walk along the streets of that little town, under the golden, and the red and the orange, trees." Darryl and Marilyn Tollerud visit their son Eric at St. Cloud State and reminisce about the early years of their courtship, Marilyn attends her parents' 60th anniversary party, and Darryl discovers a box of letters from his first love, Ellen -- a monologue from October 1999.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for July 16, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Last Saturday night, people in Lake Wobegon ate supper on their porches and went outside after the sun went down, in their shirtsleeves, and walked out under the full moon." Earl and Ruby Dickmeyer plan a trip to visit their daughter Debbie in Fort Myers, Earl's "World's Largest Pile of Burlap Bags" attracts international acclaim, and Ruby and Sister Arvonne argue about the latest selection for the ladies' book club, in a monologue from October 1997.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for July 9, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Summer has come on, the raspberries are ripe, there are hummingbirds everywhere -- it's been getting warm and humid here." Wally brings a case of mead to the Sidetrack Tap, the parents of Lake Wobegon deal with high school and college students who are home for the summer, and the perfect cover story for laziness, in a monologue from June 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Catchup - A Prairie Home Companion for July 2, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We came to Minnesota from California to simplify our lives, but maybe we forgot something..." -- A message from the Catchup Advisory Board.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for July 2, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: SFX - A Prairie Home Companion for July 2, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's good to be here in Hollywood, especially if you grew up evangelical, it makes it more meaningful..."

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for June 25, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "So, so beautiful, what a beautiful week of summer. This green all around us and this blue sky and these big white puffy clouds, like a picture that you would have made in the 4th grade with your crayons and been so proud of." Pastor Liz takes a group of teenagers on a Boundary Waters canoe trip, leads a sing-along on "Kumbaya," and tells them about her favorite boyfriend.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Trump - A Prairie Home Companion for June 25, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Enroll in a four-week course, The Art of the Trumpet. There is no need for musical talent whatsoever.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Mom - A Prairie Home Companion for June 25, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Duane's mom calls him while he's visiting a cellist Tanglewood.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Fritz - A Prairie Home Companion for June 25, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A word from Fritz Electronics: The Internet is a part of our lives and we're grateful for it, except sometimes it becomes an enemy...

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Bob - A Prairie Home Companion for June 18, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The Story of Bob, a Young Artist...

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Unfriended - A Prairie Home Companion for June 18, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Garrison sings a song about friendship on the internet.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Catchup - A Prairie Home Companion for June 18, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: He's going to make hot dogs great again.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: P.O.E.M. - A Prairie Home Companion for June 18, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The Professional Organization of English Majors: we correct because we care.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Catchup - A Prairie Home Companion for June 18, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: He's going to make hot dogs great again.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for June 18, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It has been warm, warm, warm out there, and sunny. It's been beautiful with a few little thunderstorms in there for punctuation. People love those. It's really the variety of our lives." Pastor Liz smokes a cigarette at the Chatterbox Café, Darlene's ex husband leaves his new wife, Florian Krebsbach buys a new piece of farm equipment, and the host recalls a shameful tomato incident.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Accent - A Prairie Home Companion for June 11, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A message from Earl's School of Accents: Learning a new accent can be a major asset in your professional life.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: SFX - A Prairie Home Companion for June 11, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Our sound effects man Fred Newman is looking forward to his summer vacation...

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Movie - A Prairie Home Companion for June 11, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: ...coming soon to a movie theater near you: 'The House Guest!' He's here. Deal with it.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for June 11, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been hot there this weekend, gradually getting up into the 90s, which makes Scandinavians very short-tempered. As soon as it gets up around 75, they become very impatient when they're perspiring." Mr. Halvorson decided to keep the high school's graduation ceremony outdoors in the face of threatening weather, the host recalls delivering a disastrous commencement address in 1985, and thoughts on modern grad parties.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Grads - A Prairie Home Companion for June 11, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Here's to the children who grew up to soon / who all graduated one Sunday in June...

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Advice to Graduates - A Prairie Home Companion for June 4, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A poem for all the recent graduates: "Be happy, be bold, that's what my advice is..."

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Guy Noir - A Prairie Home Companion for June 4, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Guy Noir visits the new Atlanta Braves stadium and tangles with the city's parking enforcement drones.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for June 4, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been rainy and that's a good thing, it gives you a chance to stop and think things over and relieves you of having to do the things that you thought you had to do." Pastor Inqvist and his family return for Memorial Day weekend, Clint Bunsen has a brain seizure while fixing Pastor Liz's car, and the Whippets beat the Freeport Flyers in the Toast and Jelly Days game.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Radio - A Prairie Home Companion for May 28, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: You know their voices from public radio but do you know who they are as people?

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Rehab - A Prairie Home Companion for May 28, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A song about the recent reaction to a certain presidential candidate.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: Rivers - A Prairie Home Companion for May 28, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Garrison and Heather Masse sing about the rivers of Virginia.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for May 28, 2016
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Summer has finally arrived and the birds are singing. Everything is green and people are planting now in a fury of gardening." Barbara Ann Bunsen sends her daughter to a self-esteem program, memories of great old storytellers who have passed away, and the town celebrates Memorial Day.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon

episodes.title: September 19, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's not the New Year, you know, or anything of the sort, but September: a gorgeous, gorgeous time, and the leaves are turning and the smell of apples in the air." The host recalls a notable childhood moviegoing experience, Lyle Janke's 10th grade biology class learns about bears, and a few thoughts on the power of memory.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: September 12, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It was warm and kind of windy all week and we got this terrific thunderstorm on Wednesday, which was a great boon, to get washed off like that." Fishing season begins and fishermen return to their pursuit of the famous walleye Old Pete, Luann cuts her hair very short, the town analyzes photos of Pastor Liz in Rome, and Pastor Haugen irritates his secretary Marlene, in a monologue from May 2014.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: September 5, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been kind of warm and humid here this last week and yet the migrating birds have been leaving. The orioles and the nighthawks, they know something." Lyle Janske deals with pranksters in the back of his science class, Pastor Liz leaves to write a book and is replaced by Pastor Kohler, and the Lake Wobegon Leonards lose their first game of the season.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: August 29, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been beautiful this last week. The Lake Wobegon Whippets opened their '94 home season with the annual Memorial Day doubleheader at the Wally 'Old Hard Hands' Bunsen Memorial Park." Ernie discovers the secret to a perfect knuckleball as the Whippets begin their season, high school graduates ponder their future, and the host shares a few memories of the Grand Ole Opry's last night at the Ryman, in a monologue from June 1994.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: August 22, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We got a good snow here this last week. Over this last weekend, got a foot of snow and it just cheered everybody up immediately." The fresh snow revives conversation around town, Myrtle Anderson tries to return to town 33 years after an embezzlement scandal, and everyone agrees not to turn their Christmas lights on too soon, in a November 2010 monologue.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: August 15, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "This was the week that the weather turned. The big ship swung off to the North." Carl Krebsbach tries a new and embarrassing method of leaf collection, the town celebrates Veterans Day, and newly widowed Becky Beckman keeps a final promise to her husband Bradley by taking his place on an annual deer-hunting trip, in a monologue from November 2010.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: August 8, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Something about a storm moving through just takes all your troubles with it. All the things that you were worried about this morning just go away with the storm." The Whippets lose a big game to the Avon Bards in the 9th inning, Arlene Bunsen visits her son in Houston, Texas, and an old hermit moves into the Inqvists' house and plants a magnificent garden, in a monologue from June 2008.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: August 1, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "The crocuses are up and the tulips are up, and then we got a little bit of snow overnight but nobody said a word about it." Dorothy wins the "Guess the Ice Melt" contest, Lyle watches over a tundra swan that has decided to be a dog, and Pastor Liz discards a sermon about the beauty of family, in a monologue from April 2011.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: July 25, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We had about 15 minutes of spring this year, kind of typical in Minnesota, and then it turned into summer all of a sudden." The town avoids Senator K. Thorvaldson and his boring rhubarb stories, and when Sally Emmett gets married after graduating from Macalester College, everyone is mystified by the groom's Californian parents -- a monologue from June 2002.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: July 18, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We've gotten some snow, even better than that, we've gotten frost -- frost, when you have a clear night and you have high humidity, you wake up in the morning and everything is covered with frost." A terrible flu hits Lake Wobegon, memories of ice skating and smoking in the warming house, storytelling around a bonfire on a frozen lake, and the Lutheran church ends the year with a surplus, in a monologue from January 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: July 11, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been this gorgeous, gorgeous September, this beautiful time--so much happening." Lake Wobegon welcomes the arrival of fall, a bear surprises Irene Bunsen, then stays in town, starting a debate over who will pay to have it removed, and high school students take the ACT exam, in a monologue from September 2013.

episodes.title: July 4, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Full blown summer out there. The raspberries are ripe. They're so sweet -- how we love them. The boats are out on the lake, fishing boats and pontoon boats are out there." Mr. Snecker falls asleep on the curb in front of the Chatterbox Cafe, the town holds a mostly successful 4th of July parade, and the story of the famous Living Flag.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: July 4, 2015: Bonus download! - Mom
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Mom calls to inquire about Duane's plans for Independence Day.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: July 4, 2015: Bonus download! - The Lives of the Cowboys
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Dusty and Lefty attend a cowboy contest Macalester College.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 27, 2015: Bonus download! - He Wipes the Tear from Every Eye
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Garrison and Sarah Jarosz, with a tribute to our friend Jean Redpath, who passed away last year

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 27, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been beautiful summer weather, it's been up in the 80s. We've gotten some rain, not too terribly much and everything is green." Mr. Magendantz changes his lawn-mowing pattern, Irene Bunsen creates her own tomato varieties, the town holds a tractor parade for Midsummer Day, and the host recalls attending a gospel meeting as a teenager.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 27, 2015: Bonus download! - Melville
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Author Herman Melville stops by to discuss his book 'Moby Dick.'

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 27, 2015: Bonus download! - Knee
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A word from our sponsor American Horizontal

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 27, 2015: Bonus download! - The Lives of the Cowboys
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Dusty and Lefty head to the Berkshires to become bounty hunters

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 20, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We had some storms out there but it's been all good for us. The mourning doves we hear them in the morning, we see the fireflies at night." Clarence Bunsen sleeps on his boat so he can think in the middle of the night; the story of Mr. Musselman, who was driven from town by deerflies; and the Whippets win a close game.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 20, 2015: Bonus download! - Dads / Father's Prayer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Listen to Garrison's tribute to fathers on Father's Day weekend

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 13, 2015: Bonus download! - Seattle limericks
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A few limericks featuring the cities and towns of the Seattle area

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 13, 2015: Bonus download! - Microsoft
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: We were near Redmond, the home of Microsoft, so Garrison paid tribute to software near and dear to his heart: Microsoft Word 5.1.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 13, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been hot there this last week -- got up to 93 on Wednesday and that took the starch out of Norwegian Bachelor Farmers in particular." Thoughts on the benefits of summer cabins, the Inqvists reconcile after a night at the Moonlight Bay Supper Club, and Arlene Bunsen holds a bridal shower for her nephew's fiancee.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 13, 2015: Bonus download! - Sunny Seattle Skies
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The weather in Seattle was a lot nicer than we expected this week, and Garrison wrote a song about it.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 13, 2015: Bonus download! - Seattle poem
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A celebration of the uphill lifestyle in Seattle

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 6, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been cool. There's been some rain, which we appreciate out there because it gives you a reason not to do things you thought you were going to have to do." The high school decides to hold graduation outdoors at the last minute, the class of 2015 pulls off one of the better graduation pranks in recent memory, and the town takes time to enjoy the summer weather.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: May 30, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been warm and sunny and the town is beautiful. The grass is green and the flowers are in bloom. This town looks like calendar art." Senator K. Thorvaldson returns to town after a trip through South America, the Whippets open their season but lose their ace starting pitcher in the 4th inning, and Pastor Liz loses her train of thought in the middle of a sermon.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: May 23, 2015: Bonus download! - Guy Noir
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Guy Noir heads to Washington D.C. to advise Governor Jeb Bush's presidential campaign.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: May 23, 2015: Bonus download! - Whitman / "Tenting Tonight"
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Garrison reads a letter from Civil War lieutenant George Whitman about the Battle of Antietam and sings "Tenting Tonight" with Sara Watkins, Sarah Jarosz, Aoife O'Donovan, and Rich Dworsky and The Wolves of Rhythm.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: May 23, 2015: Bonus download! - Long Weekend Blues
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: For the busy executive, Memorial Day Weekend cuts into valuable time that could be spent working.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: May 23, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been an exciting, exciting week. We had storms early in the week. Sunday and Monday, the sky got dark and, y'know, we were hoping for something really dramatic." Memories of the miraculously eventful tornado of 1985, the Lutheran Church holds its church supper in the basement due to weather, Duane Tollerud realizes he does not enjoy fishing, and the host recalls a life-changing hot air balloon ride.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: May 16, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been raining and chilly at night out there so people are way behind on lawn care, but the tulips and daffodils are in bloom." The town re-examines its philosophy on lawn care, the Lutheran Church holds its church picnic, and the war between Pastor Haugen and his secretary Marlene intensifies, in a monologue from May 2014.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon for May 9, 2015 TEST
episodes.author: American Public Media

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: May 9, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been quiet except for the storms that came through. There was one Sunday morning and Tuesday morning and Wednesday most of the day, and one just a couple of days ago." The Petersons' ice-cream-stealing dog dies, Father Wilmer visits his newfound sisters, and garage sale season begins.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: May 2, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Getting warm up there, getting up into the 60s and even thinking about getting up into the 70s so it's been very pleasant -- and no snow fell this last week." The town celebrates the 1st of May, and a few memories of post-prom parties at the Bunsens' cabin.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: April 25, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been kind of cool, sunny but windy out there, and the other day a little snow fell, just a few flakes. We ignored it. We did not comment on it." Bridal shower season arrives, Darlene invites three suitors to the Sidewinder Bar in Millet, and Arlene Bunsen counsels her goddaughter Charlotte against taking up the trombone.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: April 18, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been warm and it's getting warmer. It's been warm and windy." Clarence Bunsen observes Mrs. Rasmussen hanging her laundry out to dry, Eloise Krebsbach attends her daughter's piano recital, and some of the local farmers spend a long weekend in Las Vegas.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: April 11, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's gotten warmer and the ice is now off the lake. It just happened suddenly one day and people all pointed it out to each other, even though everybody knew it, they enjoyed saying it." The Whippets hold their first practice and add their first female player, Martha Hedlund learns more than she cared to know about her mother's personal life, Pastor Liz counsels Kate Inqvist about an unplanned pregnancy, and Senator K. Thorvaldson turns up in Costa Rica during a 21-day cruise.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: April 4, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Spring has finally arrived and the crocuses are up and the flowers are up and there's green grass and people are hanging their sheets out on the line, just for the smell of it, just for the beauty of it." Donny Krebsbach ventures onto the lake in search of early spring ice fishing, Christopher Inqvist gets a summer job at Ralph's Pretty Good Grocery, and thoughts on the importance of yard work, in a monologue from April 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: March 28, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It snowed this last week. It was harmful, it was hurtful to people, and people suffered from it. They were angry at it." The town attends the high school's production of 'Our Town,' Sarah Peterson worries her parents by becoming successful, and Mavis investigates Vern's past, in a monologue from May 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: March 21, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We're calling it spring there. It sort of seemed to be spring for a few hours here and a few hours there so that's what people are saying when they run into each other on Main Street." Spring arrives in Lake Wobegon, young people begin to go outside without jackets, and Lyle Janske runs the high school basketball concessions stand to take his mind off his son's illness, in a monologue from March 2010.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: March 14, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We've had snow out there, we've had about a foot-and-a-half of snow here this last week. It just sort of killed some people. They're just tired of winter but it snowed anyway, despite their objections." Pastor Liz returns from a vacation to Carmel, California and spends some time at the Sidetrack Tap, Marilyn Hedlund evaluates her past romances, and Clint and Irene Bunsen celebrate their 38th wedding anniversary at the Moonlight Bay Supper Club, in a monologue from February 2011.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: March 7, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It is warming up, getting up into the 30s, and 40s are forecast, and Daylight Saving Time starts on Sunday so there will be a coffee hour at the Lutheran Church one hour before the service for people who forget to turn their clocks forward." Pastor Liz delivers a sermon about the Third Commandment, high school students finish a few exams before spring break, Ronnie Detmer returns from California after 20 years, and Lillian Tollerud -- the savior of Lake Wobegon's post office -- passes away.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: February 28, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been cold here, got down to 30-below wind chill here earlier in the week, starting to warm up a little bit now. They are forecasting more snow for Monday, Tuesday night." Corrine Tollerud returns from St. Olaf College for a weekend, the Hansens attempt to prevent their dog from being hit by cars, Lake Wobegon Lutheran Church holds its Lenten services, and Cindy Hedlund meets someone online after just a few months as a widow.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: February 21, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been cold, but not that cold, and people are in a sort of festive mood." High school students dress up to celebrate Snow Week; the men's bible study group holds its Chili Dump; the story of Edgar "Left Foot" Mueller, who owned the Alhambra Ballroom; and the Sons of Knute begin their "Guess the Ice Melt" contest.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: The News from Lake Wobegon, February  7, 2015
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The News from Lake Wobegon

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: January 31, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been a very mild winter here so far. It was temperatures in the 30s here this last week, which makes us feel very uneasy." Thoughts on the future of Minnesota winters and the state's notoriety for harsh weather, the proper way to free a car stuck in a snowbank, and the benefits of competency.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: January 24, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It has been unnaturally warm out there and that has gotten the raccoons thinking that this is the breeding season." A mysterious figure skater out on the lake draws a crowd, Senator K. Thorvaldson finally heads south for the winter, and Donald Thorvaldson catches up with a few classmates.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: January 17, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It has been warm this week, got up into the 30s, and so the sidewalks have been clear, and people have been walking out again." The Sons of Knute host their January gala, the flu comes to Lake Wobegon, and Eloise Krebsbach attempts to live a stress-free life.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: January 10, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been cold out there, you know that. Wednesday the high was 8 below, which is an interesting phenomenon, when the peak is below you." Schools are closed statewide due to bitterly cold temperatures, people feel encumbered by Christmas gifts they did not want, and Clarence and Arlene Bunsen head to California for a winter vacation.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: January 3, 2015: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We got a little snow -- a little snow Monday night. What a beautiful snowfall it was, and not all that cold out." Unseasonably warm weather puts those who suffer from "Pump Handle Phobia" at ease. Plus, Mr. Hansen lends a hand around the neighborhood while his wife visits her sister in Florida, and reveals an unusual secret, in a monologue from January 2012.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: December 27, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "They got snow out there and it turned good and cold and people are cheerful. People are more cheerful when it's bitterly cold out there, because what is the choice?" Sidetrack Tap patrons perform some impromptu satellite dish maintenance, Irene and Clint Bunsen prepare for the holidays, Pastor Liz hosts a caroling party that gets the town talking, and memories of early television in Lake Wobegon, in a monologue from December 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: December 20, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We've got snow, we've got snow, so we're covered. Don't worry about us. We're just fine. Not so much sun this week." Clint and Irene Bunsen serve Artillery Punch at their Christmas party, Pastor Liz's mysterious gentleman friend causes a stir, and a few Christmas carols from the townspeople.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: December 13, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It has been warm out there, warm out there, and misty, and cloudy, and the snow is melting. It would be gloomy weather if you and I were sensitive people, which, thank goodness, we are not." The local churches prepare for Christmas, Marilyn Tollerud receives a disturbing late-night call from her daughter Sharon, and a few thoughts on the benefits of winter.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: December 6, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "You've come to that long, cold, dark time of the year. Not much can be said about that, except that if you have not spent December in the north of Norway, then you don't know what 'cold and dark' is." Pastor Inqvist considers writing a book about Lake Wobegon, Dorothy second-guesses a sentence in her Christmas letter, and Betty Ingebretsen accompanies the 4th and 5th grade carolers at the Good Shepherd Home.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: November 29, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It was good and cold on Thanksgiving Day, which was good. It just made Thanksgiving feel more necessary somehow." Families destroy the social order by purchasing their Thanksgiving meals online, The Host prepares a subpar Grape Salad, and a few observations about unique holiday traditions.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: November 22, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "We got some more snow here this last week and it's been a little bit cold--no big deal. People are cheerful out there. Furnaces are on now." The town prepares for ice fishing season, Solveig returns from California to make lutefisk, and the exiles begin to trickle back home for Thanksgiving.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: November 15, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It snowed on Monday, early Monday morning. We got about 12-and-a-half inches there in Lake Wobegon. There was no big fuss about it." Margie Krebsbach's English class discusses 'The Great Gatsby,' Clint Bunsen tangles with two deer who find their way into town, and Dorothy recalls the story of Harold Hansen and Oscar Peterson.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: November 8, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "There was a full moon on Thursday, it snowed a little bit, the sun now goes down before five o'clock and will for a while. Cold is here. The kids are still wearing light jackets because they're from here, that's all." Lake Wobegon Lutheran Church celebrates All Saints' Day and Clint Bunsen gives up deer hunting.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: November 1, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's November, here we are, and on Sunday we fall back. We get an extra hour on early Sunday morning so there will be a large number of people coming in late to church." Cold weather returns to Lake Wobegon, advice on leaving Minnesota, and why jokes are a bridge between people who disagree with each other.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: October 25, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been cloudy. It's been chilly out there. The sun has come out now and then. And then on Thursday this powerful wind came up -- it was very dramatic." A big wind causes havoc all over town, Mrs. Jensen's old boyfriend Kurt visits from the city, and Darlene meets a coyote that resembles her Uncle George, in a monologue from October 2011.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: October 18, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been chilly, of course, because it is almost the end of October. Mist over the lake every morning, the Canada Geese are heading South overhead." Pastor Liz delivers a sermon about the Parable of the Wedding Feast, a man visits Ralph's Pretty Good Grocery to buy a cup of coffee though they don't sell coffee, and the story of the time Eugene Berge picked up a hitchhiker.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: October 11, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's fall. It's a gorgeous, gorgeous fall. It's been chilly, down into the 30s at night." Thoughts on the benefits of cold weather and Minnesota living, the town watches a lunar eclipse, and Pastor Liz moves into the Lewises' cabin.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: October 4, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Been chilly, chilly at night, in the 30s. The crickets are all quiet. We hear the 'pop' of the shotguns from duck hunting." With the election approaching, politics begin to affect marriages, Carla Bunsen receives funding for her performance art piece in New York City, and the Lutheran Church holds its Senior Banquet.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: September 27, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been this gorgeous, gorgeous September, this beautiful time--so much happening." Lake Wobegon welcomes the arrival of fall, a bear surprises Irene Bunsen, then stays in town, starting a debate over who will pay to have it removed, and high school students take the ACT exam, in a monologue from September 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: September 20, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Beautiful, beautiful week of fall. Mists on the lake early in the morning, you wake up in the morning, your window is open, you've got a little extra blanket over you." Pastor Liz fills in while the Lutheran Church interviews replacements for Pastor Haugen, news of Marlene's interesting encounter with Father Wilmer spreads through the town, Mrs. Anderson holds a CD release party at the Sidewinder Bar, and the Tolleruds' rooster Ludwig comes to a sad end.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: September 13, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been a beautiful, beautiful week. It's been warm and sunny--gets up into the 90s in the afternoon but the mornings are perfect." The town deals with a heat wave and the meanest woman in Lake Wobegon passes away, in a monologue from June 2012.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: September 6, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been getting warmer up there. The tulips are up a little bit, and the irises, and the lily of the valley as well." Pastor Liz and Clint Bunsen spend some time together while digging a grave for Liz Tollefson, and Pastor Anderson weeps during her funeral service, in a monologue from March 2013.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: August 30, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Summer coming to an end and fall is about to begin. The nights are getting cool, sunset coming earlier and earlier, and in the morning there's fog -- mist out on the lake -- and we can feel it coming." Thoughts on the virtues of sweet corn and the exquisite boredom of summer, remembering Roger Hedlund with a story about his high school basketball days, and Pastor Liz returns from Rome to visit Marlene.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: August 23, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It was very brutally, brutally hot here this last week and the deerflies came in, which is a form of plague." Powerful storms roll into Lake Wobegon, Luanne Peterson copes with the arrival of a new patient in the pediatric intensive care unit, and a story to comfort Luanne when she breaks down under an overpass during the storm, in a monologue from June 2012.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: August 16, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Our beautiful fall has come to an end. We got a frost here on Monday Night. People were talking about it down at the Chatterbox Cafe." A monologue from October 2013, Eloise Krebsbach runs for mayor, the Lutheran Church updates its directory, Carl Krebsbach does a few odd jobs around town, and the Hedlunds dig up a Lake Wobegon ghost story.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: August 9, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "Had a little bit of front on Monday just to remind us, you know, where we live. But otherwise it was warm. It was up in the 60s." In a monologue from April 2012, the Lake Wobegon Whippets take some spring batting practice, Bud learns a lesson about friendship while putting the dock in the water, and Pastor Liz has an exciting evening on Easter Sunday.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: August 2, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It was the end of school on Wednesday and it was high school graduation on Thursday evening -- some major, major events in our town." A few women appoint themselves "Pentecost Monitors" at the Lutheran Church, Pastor Ingqvist counsels prospective newlyweds, and the high school seniors play their annual practical joke on Superintendent Halvorson, in a monologue from June 2009.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: July 26, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been hot out there this last week. It's been humid too, so that you wake up in the morning and there's a mist out over the meadows, beautiful mist with the sun shining through it." Gladys feels a longing for doomed love while listening to the opera, the Hansens' dove-breeding business goes awry, Judy Ingqvist searches for elegance, and a few verses of "Aften (Stille, Hjerte, Sol gaar ned)," in a monologue from June 2007.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: July 19, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "It's been beautiful this last week. The Lake Wobegon Whippets opened their '94 home season with the annual Memorial Day doubleheader at the Wally 'Old Hard Hands' Bunsen Memorial Park." Ernie discovers the secret to a perfect knuckleball as the Whippets begin their season, high school graduates ponder their future, and the host shares a few memories of the Grand Ole Opry's last night at the Ryman, in a monologue from June 1994.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: July 12, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "I get this far away from home -- couple thousand miles -- and I stay away for a long time, and I start to wonder if it's a real place or if I made it up." The town's children spend Thanksgiving sick and in bed, Senator K. Thorvaldson's mysterious love Laura comes to town to meet his family, and a few verses of "My Father, How Long," in a monologue from November 1985.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: July 5, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "The rains have finally let up and we had sunshine here this week and it was a glorious, glorious 4th of July in Lake Wobegon." Marlene wins the "Best Pie in Town" contest, the World's Largest Pile of Burlap Bags celebrates its 40th anniversary, and to avoid unwanted attention, the town decides not to mark its 150th anniversary.

episodes.seriesTitle: A Prairie Home Companion: News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.title: June 28, 2014: The News from Lake Wobegon
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: "This is the shank of summer. It's such a gorgeous time of year. It's been so beautiful in Lake Wobegon. The yards, the lawns have never looked more beautiful than they do right now." Thoughts on lawn maintenance and strawberry-rhubarb pie, the Tollefson boy considers moving to Los Angeles, and a deerfly bite helps the Whippets continue their winning season.
